title: hemzer
author: hemzer
content: Hi I downloaded 4.3.2 but I do not see anywhere the support for LNURL. What am I missing? Any plugins I need?can anyone help me please.thank you

comments.author: Husna QA
comments.body: Quote from: hemzer on September 30, 2022, 04:22:01 PMHi I downloaded 4.3.2 but I do not see anywhere the support for LNURL. What am I missing? Any plugins I need?can anyone help me please.thank youYou don't need any plugins.Since Electrum 4.3.0. (https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/blob/5a64d62b248cea8edcf1f36ef2262679505a18a7/RELEASE-NOTES#L83), the LNURL-pay feature has been supported.Have you done 'Open Channel' to use the Lightning Network feature in Electrum?

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: hemzer on September 30, 2022, 04:22:01 PMHi I downloaded 4.3.2 but I do not see anywhere the support for LNURL. What am I missing? Any plugins I need?I saw your replies in "Electrum 4.3.0 Releases" thread (link to the 1st reply),and it seems you've already found out how to send using LNURL but you're still looking where to put or load "LN URL withdrawl"?If so, in the 'Release Notes', it stated that it only added support for LNURL-pay (LUD-06), not LNURL-withdraw (LUD-03).

comments.author: hemzer
comments.body: Quote from: nc50lc on October 01, 2022, 05:41:35 AMQuote from: hemzer on September 30, 2022, 04:22:01 PMHi I downloaded 4.3.2 but I do not see anywhere the support for LNURL. What am I missing? Any plugins I need?I saw your replies in "Electrum 4.3.0 Releases" thread (link to the 1st reply),and it seems you've already found out how to send using LNURL but you're still looking where to put or load "LN URL withdrawl"?If so, in the 'Release Notes', it stated that it only added support for LNURL-pay (LUD-06), not LNURL-withdraw (LUD-03).Got it. Thanks a lot. I skipped that part. Thank for knocking it into me. :-)
